newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Yukong sees '96 net falling sharply.
newsitem.headline: Yukong sees '96 net falling sharply.

text.p: Yukong Ltd, South Korea's largest oil refiner, is expected to post a net profit of about 65 billion won in calendar 1996, down sharply from 103.2 billion in 1995, a company official said on Wednesday.
The official in Yukong's finance division said the refiner saw 1996 sales at around 8.3 trillion won against 6.59 trillion won in 1995.
"Decline in net profit is due mostly to foreign exchange loss," he said. The South Korean won fell 8.2 percent against the dollar last year.
A rise in crude oil prices also pressured the refiner, he said.
Yukong plans to release its corporate results on Friday.
